hypothesis_content.title: Single-Stock Catalyst Spillover into Sector Token Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: A significant positive catalyst for a publicly-traded crypto equity (e.g., COIN stock-trading rollout, broker upgrade) will generate amplified and persistent alpha in related crypto 'sector' tokens (e.g., exchange tokens, DeFi tokens) versus broad market (BTC), but only if the broader market regime is NEUTRAL or BULL. The sector token basket will outperform BTC by >3% over the 3 days following the equity catalyst.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Positive news for a bellwether equity validates a business model or growth trajectory for an entire crypto sub-sector. In neutral/bull regimes, risk appetite is sufficient for this narrative to flow from traditional markets into crypto tokens, as traders seek higher-beta plays on the same theme. The lag exists due to information diffusion and the need for equity market closure/analysis.
entry_conditions: Major crypto equity (COIN, MSTR, RIOT, etc.) experiences a >8% single-day move on a company-specific, fundamental catalyst (earnings, product launch, regulatory win).
A defined basket of related crypto sector tokens (e.g., for COIN: FTT, KCS, LEO, etc.) has not already moved >5% in the 24 hours prior to the equity move.
Enter long the sector basket/short BTC (or use a dedicated index if available) at the open of the next crypto trading session (00:00 UTC).

exit_conditions.take_profit: Cumulative sector basket vs. BTC spread reaches +4%.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The sector token basket fails to outperform BTC over the 3-day window in more than 60% of qualifying instances, indicating no reliable spillover effect or that the information is immediately arbitraged.
